intro: Myosurus shortii, commonly known as the shortii's mouse-ear, is a small flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that produces seeds in small, dry fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
